channel.title: [Delta] sM Colors
channel.description:
Okay, well I've added server announcements to my server, but, I try to make them be in colors. So, I added this code. [code]sM("@red@Don't forget to vote!");[/code]
And when the message appears, it appears as "@red@Don't forget to vote!"
So, It's just going in as text, and not changing the colors..
Also, in-game, when I type "@red@" it also appears as text, but if I do "red:" it will appear red. But, if I do "red:" in the announcement it also appears as text, and not changing colors.

item.title: [Delta] sM Colors
item.dc:creator: @RSX RSX_
item.description:
@RSX wrote:

It has nothing to do with syntax, hex codes won’t help either, just change

to

in Client.java

Read full topic

item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

http://www.febooti.com/products/iezoom/online-help/online-color-chart-picker.html
just look up the red hex, then u would see more ( i believe there is another type of hex to, cant remember atm)

Read full topic

item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

What exactly would be the hex versions?

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] sM Colors
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Native^:

Then there is something not added in your client, I think. Maybe you could rip it from another client.

It could also be he is not using the right syntax, but yes this is client sided. client.java in the client search for the hex version of the colors

Read full topic

item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Okay, well I’ve added server announcements to my server, but, I try to make them be in colors. So, I added this code.

And when the message appears, it appears as
“@red@Don’t forget to vote!”

So, It’s just going in as text, and not changing the colors…

Also, in-game, when I type “@red@” it also appears as text, but if I do “red:” it will appear red. But, if I do “red:” in the announcement it also appears as text, and not changing colors.
